AttributeLocalizations.Name: Force
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines output capacity for melee classes, current output capacity is {rate}.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Intelligence
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines output capacity for caster classes, current output capacity is {rate}.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Agility
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines battle turn progress speed. When Hit Rate Adjustment and Dodge Rate Adjustment are presented, agility can increase hit/dodge rate as well. Current hit rating is {hitrating} and dodge rating is {dodgerating}. (Both can be increased par relevant adjustment rates).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Critical Hit Rate
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines the chance of dealing critical damage or heal.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Vitalité
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines max health points, current max health points is {rate}.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dommage de Coup Critique
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines critical hit damage/heal.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Physique Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against physical damage. Reduces {rate}% physical damage done par lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Resistance Feu
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against fire damage. Reduces {rate}% fire damage done par lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Ombre Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against shadow damage. Reduces {rate}% shadow damage done par lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Glace Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against ice damage. Reduces {rate}% ice damage done par lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Resistance Poison
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against poison damage. Reduces {rate}% poison damage done par lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Divine Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against divine damage. Reduces {rate}% divine damage done par lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Resistance Foudre
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against lightning damage. Reduces {rate}% lightning damage done par lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: All Elemental Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against all elemental damage, check individual elemental resistance for details

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Vie par Coup
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Rate of heal per damage dealt, up to 20% of wearer's total health points.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Taunt on Hit
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Chance of taunting target per hit for 3 seconds

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Stun on Hit
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Chance of stunning target for 2 seconds on hit

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Damage Reflection
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of damage to be reflected back to attacker. Damage values used for reflection calculation are raw damage (no resistance reductions), and reflected damage is of type Real Damage.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Combat Recovery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Heal rate at the start of each battle.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Turn Recovery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Heal rate each turn.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Mining Mastery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases the amount of ores dropped from enemies.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Logging Mastery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases the amount of timbers dropped from enemies.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Hunting Mastery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases the amount of hides dropped from enemies.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Heal Effectivenesss
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases heal received.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dommage de Feu Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases fire damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dommage Physique Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases physical damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Resilience
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Decreases critical damage received

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Damage Reduction
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Further reduces all damage taken after resistance calculations

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dommage de Glace Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases ice damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dommage d'Ombre Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases shadow damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dommage de Poison Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases poison damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dommage Divine Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases divine damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dommage de Foudre Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases lightning damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Rage Efficiency
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Decreases tactic rage cost, up to 80%.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Heal Absorption
AttributeLocalizations.Description: The portion of direct heal gets converted into damage absorption shield, up to adventurer's maximum health points.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Effect Mastery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases lasting time of all positive and negative effects from skills, tactic and items.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Hit Rate Adjustment
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases percentage of agility participating in Hit Rate Calculation for enemies that can dodge. Higher values grant higher hit rate.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dodge Rate Adjustment
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Enables dodge and increases percentage of agility participating in Hit Rate Calculation. Higher values grant higher dodge rate.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Effect Hit Rating
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Reduces enemies' chance of resisting caster's negative effects. Useful on higher level enemies (lv.80+).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Effect Resistance Rating
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases chances of resisting negative effects.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Whenever deals a critical direct damage, target will be stun for [variable] seconds, this effect can be stacked.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Whenever deals direct damage from skill, all damage over time effects on target will instantly release all remaining damage, up to a maximum of 3000% caster's output capacity

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Dark Knight Rage
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Whenever adventurers use rage points, Dark Knight's {attributes} will be boosted par {rate}%.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Rage Heal
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Whenever adventurers use rage points, Dark Knight is healed par {rate}% of rage points used.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Darkness Revenge
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:
During adventure, all direct damage recevied par adventurers will add one layer of 'Darkness Revenge', deals {damagepersecond}% of final damage per second. 
Whenever 'Darkness Revenge' triggers, {chargerate}% of 'Corrupted Force' is accumulated, when fully charged, all adventurers' agility will be reduced par {agilityrate}% and rage generation reduced par {ragerate}%. Up to 10 stacks.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Red Flames
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:
Bête de Sang en Pierre has {chance}% chance of planting fire seed to a random adventurer, dealing 100% fire damage when ignited. 
 Bête de Sang en Pierre may revive once, and recovers {healrate}% of maximum health. Its skill will be changed to {skill} and cast immediately upon revive.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Inversed Mandate
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Turn progresses will charge {chargerate}% of 'Inversed Mandate'. When fully charged, 'Temps Freeze' will be unleashed to all adventurers, stun everyone for {seconds} seconds, and receives {damagerate}% {damagetype} per second.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Poison Mist
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: There is {chance}% chance of adding one layer of 'Poison' to all adventurers every second, dealing {damage} {damagetype} per second

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Demon Skull
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:
Whenever Demon Skull is attacked, there is {bleedingchance}% chance causing attackers to bleed for {bleedingseconds} seconds.
 Each bleeding trigger charges {chargerate}% of 'Soul Collection', which may grant Demon Skull {agilityboost} agility when fully charged.
Demon skull may revive once, and immediately add {revivelayers} bleeding effects for all adventurers. Moreover, 'Soul Collection' may grant additional {strengthboost} strength.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Corrupted Horn
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Whenever a unit dies, wearer may do an immediate turn.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Whenever a unit dies, wearer may do an immediate turn.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Restless Souls
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: All enemies may revive once, and recover {reviverate}% of their maximum health

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Thousand Worms
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:
Deadly worms crawl to adventurers each second. Whenever adventurer has {max} on his/her body, a poisonous explosion is triggered to all adventurers, dealing {damagerate}% {damagetype} per worm. 
Worm Nest casts 'Gu' every {chargetime} seconds, stun all adventurers for {stunseconds} seconds, sucking life, equals to {lifedrinkrate}% of Wom Nest's output, out of adventurers. Any divine damage may interrupt 'Gu', and stun Worm Nest for {selfstuns} seconds.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Darkness
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: All enemies' output capacity is reduced par {outputdepression}%, and all units' heal effectiveness is reduced par {healdrop}%.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Death Ombre
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:
Enters Chaotic mode every {chargeseconds} seconds, and can be interrupted par direct divine damage. When not interrupted, 'Inversed Kill' is unleashed after {channeling} seconds, dealing {damagerate}% {damagetype} to a random adventurer.
After revived, Cool Down for Chaotic Mode is reduced to {revivedchargeseconds} seconds.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Blessed Sin
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: All enemy units have {hithealrate}% of Heal on Hit. In addition, all units receive {damage} damage ({damagetypes}) per second.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Protection
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:
Whenever Bloody Eye is attacked, attacker will receive a 'Strange Ghost' effect for {seconds} seconds, and each attack will heal Bloody Eye for {healvalue}. 
In addition, damage dealt on Beast of Atonement will be shared 200% to Bloody Eye. When either beasts is killed, 'Strange Ghost' may no longer be effective.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Divine Blindness
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Cast 'Divine Blindness' every {seconds} seconds, and push back all adventurers turn progress par {rate}%.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Hydra Spirit
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Heals all party members for {healrate}% every {seconds} seconds, and bless them with 'Feu Spirit'. When blessed par {max} 'Feu Spirits', unit may be revived once.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Inversed Universe
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:
Heals {healrate}% of maximum health per second. Every {immuneseconds} seconds, Demon Dragon shifts to be immune to a random elemental damage type.
Demon Dragon slowly charges 'Heavenly Force', and every {powerchargecap} seconds it is fully charged and has its output capacity boosted par {boostrate}%, all direct damage received may push back charges par {push} second(s). 
Whenever Demon Dragon grants {stack} 'Heavenly Force', it deals {explosive}% {damagetype} to all adventurers, and stuns them for {stun} seconds. 
Demon Dragon's power is contrainted in current form, every type of elemental damage can increase all damage it receives par {damageincrease}% for {lasting}seconds.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Effect Resistances
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Reduce lasting times of all negative effects par {rate}%. For turn-based effects, a minimum of 1 turn is allowed.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Reduce lasting times of all negative effects par [variable percentage]. For turn-based effects, a minimum of 1 turn is allowed.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Tricky Defense
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Whenever effect wearer is hit par direct damage, all friendly units are healed par {healrate}% of effect wearer's output capacity.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Whenever effect wearer is hit par direct damage, all friendly units are healed par [variable percentage] of effect wearer's output capacity.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Morale
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Recovers {ragestart} rage points when battle starts, and speeds up all tactic Cooling Down time par {cd} seconds.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Recovers [variable] rage points when battle starts, and speeds up all tactic Cooling Down time par [variable] seconds.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Fierytale
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Plant fire seed of 100% output capacity {start} time(s) on all enemy targets when battle starts. Each direct damage plants additional fire seed of 100% output capacity {perhit} time(s).
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Plant fire seed of 100% output capacity [variable] time(s) on all enemy targets when battle starts. Each direct damage plants additional fire seed of 100% output capacity [variable] time(s).

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Transcendence
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Whenever an unit dies, carrier's output capacity is increased par {rate}%
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Whenever an unit dies, carrier's output capacity is increased par [variable percentage]

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Enlightenment
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Every {numberofseconds} seconds, cast {skill}

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Protector's Pride
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: When battle starts, wearer is blessed with {shield} shields, and whenever wearer receives damage, there is {chance}% chance attacker is taunted.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: When battle starts, wearer is blessed with [variable] shields, and whenever wearer receives damage, there is [variable] chance attacker is taunted.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Killing Intent
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: {chance}% of accumulating {layerpertick} 'Killing Intent' per second. When {max} accumulated, wearer's agility and output are boosted par {boostrate}%, turn progress is boosted par {pushrate}%, and number of skill targets is increased par {extra}

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Rejuvenation
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Heal {rate}% of maximum health per second

SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Young Warlock exclusive: If Curse of the Dead cannot kill any unit, boosts caster’s Intelligence par [variable percentage] for 2 turns.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Ghosting
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Having more than one adventurer of the same class in battle reduces all party members’ battle stats: reduces output capacity, agility, resistances, critical damage and resilience par {rate}% for every repeating unit.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Access Restriction
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: You can only send up to {number} adventurers in this dungeon level: the remaining units in adventurer selection list will not be able to join battle.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Grand Heal
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Heals all party members for {rate}% of their maximum health points when battle starts and excessed heal will be converted to damage absorption shield.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Heals all party members for [variable percentage] of their maximum health points when battle starts and excessed heal will be converted to damage absorption shield.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Power of Darkness
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Young Warlock exclusive: every dead unit in battle boosts Young Warlock’s Output Capacité par {outputrate}% and All Resistances par {resistance}%.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Young Warlock exclusive: every dead unit in battle boosts Young Warlock’s Output Capacité par [variable percentage] and All Resistances par [variable percentage].

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Demon of the Night
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Night Lame exclusive (unique): increases Effect Hit Rating par {boost}. Poisonous Mist also decreases targets’ Effect Hit Rating par {decay}%. In addition, enemy unit receives physical damage equals to {damage}% of Night Lame’s Output Capacité when performs turns.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Night Lame exclusive (unique): increases Effect Hit Rating par [variable]. Poisonous Mist also decreases targets’ Effect Hit Rating par [variable percentage]. In addition, enemy unit receives physical damage equals to [variable percentage] of Night Lame’s Output Capacité when performs turns.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Hold On!
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Chubby Lady exclusive (unique): increases maximum absorbable values for all party members’ Damage Absorption Shields par {boost}%. In addition, increases Rotation’s damage rate per hit par {damage}%.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Chubby Lady exclusive (unique): increases maximum absorbable values for all party members’ Damage Absorption Shields par [variable percentage]. In addition, increases Rotation’s damage rate per hit par [variable percentage].

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Karma
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Each healer heals all party members {healrate}% (of output capacity) health points at start of battle. In addition, party members can absorb {damagerate}% of direct damage values received as output boost, and this effect lasts until wearer deals damage or casts skill/tactic.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Each healer heals all party members [variable percentage] (of output capacity) health points at start of battle. In addition, party members can absorb [variable percentage] of direct damage values received as output boost, and this effect lasts until wearer deals damage or casts skill/tactic.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Thorns
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description: Aventurier with the highest Damage Reflection Rate at the start of battle will share 1000% of it to all party members.
SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Aventurier with the highest Damage Reflection Rate at the start of battle will share 1000% of it to all party members.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Guilt

SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: All party members’ Hit Rate Adjustment Rate is increased par [variable percentage], Effect Resistance Rate is decreased par [variable percentage], and direct damage released from skill/tactic that are targeting all enemy units are increased par [variable percentage]

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Annihilate

SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Every negative effect on enemy unit decreases its Effect Resistance Rate par [variable percentage] (up to 100%) and Output Capacité par [variable percentage] (up to 50%)

SpecialEffectLocalizations.GeneralInfo: Direct damage targeting single unit are increased par [variable percentage], and each additional target will reduce this bonus par [variable percentage]

ManualLocalizations.Name: Upgrade Cards
ManualLocalizations.Description:
The player may level up adventurers par spending practice points. 

Every 3 levels, the player is given the opportunity to pick up an upgrade card for the adventurer.

Upgrade cards can boost adventurer’s attributes, unlock tactics and enable elemental effects.

The player may redraw existing upgrade cards par spending Or. There is no limit on the number of redraws, although with each redraw the cost may increase.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Tactiques
ManualLocalizations.Description:
On the first Upgrade Card selection at level 3, a ‘Tactic Unlock’ card may be drawn. Selecting this card enables the adventurer’s tactic. If the player does not choose this card at level 3, it may be drawn in later Upgrade Card draws. Only level 3 guarantees the ‘Tactic Unlock’ card to be drawn.

In battles, the player may use tactics par spending ‘Rage Points’. Each adventurer type has their own unique tactic.

Each tactic also includes a 'tactic aura', a passive effect which is enabled while the player has enough rage points to use the tactic.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Elements and Effect
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Aventurier has his/her own element, e.g. Feu Player’s element is Feu.

Aventurier’s own element forms part of their final damage, although it may not be the only damage element. Skills may incur additional elemental damage, for instance Feu Charger’s skill can deal fire, lightning and caster’s own elemental damage. Additional details can be found in skill description tooltips for each adventurer.

Moreover, adventurer’s equipment may deal additional elemental damage, e.g. item with effect ‘30% chance of dealing 200% ice damage to all enemy units on hit’ may deal ice damage on top of adventurer’s skill/tactic damage.

Aventurier’s primary elemental effect is unlocked at level 15, and other elemental effects are unlocked at level 30. Details of elemental effects can be viewed in Aventurier Panel.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Gemmes
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Gemmes can be looted from monsters.

Players may embed Gemmes into adventurers’ equipment, to receive the attribute boosts on the Gemme as well as activate Gemme set effects.

The set bonus effect on Gemmes is activate whenever the adventurer has the requisite number of Gemmes listed on the set effect. They will be active so long as the Gemme has the same name, even if the Gemmes are not all at the same level. 

Players may purchase a 'Emplacement Patch' to give equipment additional sockets.

Weapons can have 4 sockets, and armors can only have 3 sockets.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Primary Attribute and Output Capacité
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Each adventurer has a primary attribute, e.g. Fashion Boy’s primary attribute is intelligence, Warrior’s primary attribute is strength.

Players may view adventurer’s primary attribute in ‘Aventurier Panel’.

Aventurier’s primary attribute value is determined par their primary attribute. For instance, a Missionary with 100 intelligence has 100 output capacity.

When the term ‘Output Capacity’ is used in skill descriptions, it directly uses this number to determine results, i.e. ‘200% (of caster’s output capacity) fire damage’ means 240 fire damage for a caster with 120 intelligence, before resistances and other modifiers.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Defense and Damage Reduction
ManualLocalizations.Description:
All damage may be reduced par the relevant damage resistance, e.g. 200 physical damage on a target with 1000 physical resistance will result in considerably lower final damage.

In addition to resistances, damage can also be reduced par Resilience whenever the target receives a critical strike.

There are more methods to reduce damage in the game, such as skills or item effects, so be sure to keep an eye out for more!

ManualLocalizations.Name: Invitations and Aventuriers
ManualLocalizations.Description:
The Inn is the only place to acquire new adventurers.

Every 20 game days, new adventures may visit the Inn. There is also a chance for a new adventurer to visit the inn upon a successful adventure.

Aventurier's will stay at the inn for 45 days, and will leave afterwards if they are not hired.

At the beginning of the game, the player is given the invitations for the classes Killer, Street Man, Drunk Reader, and Missionary par default. As the player completes more adventures and acquires new invitations, adventurers of new classes may visit the inn!

ManualLocalizations.Name: Aventurier’s Rarity
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Aventuriers can be found at the different rarity grades of normal, rare, epic, legendary, and ancient. Aventuriers of different grades have different growth potentials, and can even have different growth potentials within the same rarity. 

Rarity determines the potential stat gains on level-ups.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Reputation and Town Titles
ManualLocalizations.Description:
As the player advances towards higher dungeon levels, the reputation of the town also increases, acquiring new titles for the town as a result.

Higher town titles allow applications of town residents with higher contributions, as well as unlocking higher level Recettes later in the game.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Residents
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Upon a successful adventure, new resident applications will be available in town hall

Residents may provide various contributions to the town, as well as having various exploration attributes.

As the player advances to higher level dungeons, town reputation increases, and residents with higher contribution stats will apply to live in town.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Exploration
ManualLocalizations.Description:
When the player has acquired town title 'Salvation of Heaven', a new quest 'Exploration' is given. Completing the quest enables the 'Exploration' feature.

The player may send out adventurers and residents for explorations, looting treasures from overseas. While on an exploration, residents continue to give their town contribution, but adventurers cannot be used in battle.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Damage
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Damage can be categorized into Direct Damage and Non-Direct Damage.

Direct Damage is instant damage done par skills, passives and items. Direct Damage is required to trigger different effects. E.g. Poison Element Effect: Direct poison damage causes targets bleed for 3 seconds.

Non-Direct Damage includes Damage-over-Temps and reflected damage. Non-Direct Damage cannot trigger effects.

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Tea Party
TownEventLocalizaitons.Description: Attracts 1 adventurer of Supporter role (10-80% increased quality chance boost) to visit the Inn. Increases all resistances for adventurers in battle. Unlocks at 'Dragon's Blessing'.

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Meditation
